attributes.action: amend banking legislation in order to re-introduce Welsh banknotes.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Welsh banknotes were last in circulation before the North & South Wales Bank was taken over by Midland Bank in 1908.  Today, Wales is the only constituent part of the United Kingdom that is prohibited from issuing its own banknotes.  On the 10th of June, 2008 the futue of Scottish and Northern Irish notes was secured by the UK Treasury.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
